title: Galil Mountain 2016 Merlot (Upper Galilee)
description: A bouquet of raspberry, strawberry and Mediterranean herbs preps the palate for flavors of blackberry, cassis, vanilla, lavender and black pepper. It is well integrated, with velvety tannins and spicy finish.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2016 Mountain Cuvée Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a well-blended red, combining 73% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. Pungent earth and tobacco highlight a soft round palate of dried herb, clove and red and black currant, finishing in cherry-vanilla.

title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Steinmetz Riesling (Mosel)
description: Delicate tangerine and yellow peach flavors are layered in smoke and dusty slate in this sprightly off-dry Riesling. It's a light-footed, piercing wine anchored by nervous lemon-lime acidity. The finish is long and lean, accented by a touch of dried herb.

title: Kasteelberg 2015 Shiraz (Swartland)
description: This is a friendly, attractive and easy to like bottling. It boasts solid fruit concentration, expressed in waves of raspberry sauce, brambly boysenberry and just a touch of dark chocolate. The medium-weight palate shows a bit more restraint, with herbal tones of raspberry leaf and cherry stem. Drink now–2020.

title: La Montina 2011 Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: White field flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of brioche delicately lift from the glass. On the palate, an elegant perlage and tangy acidity brighten Golden Delicious apple, yellow pear, lemon zest and a hint of hazelnut.

title: Le Marchesine NV Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Crisp and refreshing, this opens with enticing scents of white spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of dried aromatic herb. The bright palate delivers creamy golden apple and juicy nectarine alongside tangy acidity and a lively mousse. A ginger note backs up the finish.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2009 Lagunilla Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Classic Rioja aromas of vanilla, tobacco and dried red fruits are on display. In the mouth, this wine has bracing natural acidity that supports ripe flavors of baked berry fruits and brown sugar. Raisiny hints on the finish suggest drinking this sooner rather than later.

title: Moniker 2016 La Ribera Vineyard Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This wine is delightfully smooth as it delivers moderate fruit, butter and almond flavors on a rich-feeling yet light texture. It coats the palate from the first sip through to the mild, lingering finish.

title: Nera 2010 Grumello Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This opens with delicate aromas suggesting small red berry, pipe tobacco and a whiff of chopped mint. The smooth bright palate delivers crushed strawberry, orange zest, a hint of clove and a smoky mineral note. Buffed tannins and vibrant acidity provide support. Drink over the next few years.

title: Pflüger 2015 Friedelsheimer Trocken St. Laurent (Pfalz)
description: Plump and fleshy yet crisply balanced, this fruity, full-bodied red offers an abundance of ripe blackberry and cherry accented by dark char, bitter chocolate and spice. It's rich and silken on the palate, finishing with ripe, pleasantly drying tannins.

title: Polvanera 2013 17 Vigneto Montevella Primitivo (Gioia del Colle)
description: Sourced from the clay soils of the Montevella Vineyard, this Primitivo sees no time in oak, yet brims with complexities. Bergamot, cedar oil and moist earth aromas ride over a core of dense blackberry. These notes echo on the full-bodied palate, balanced by vibrant acidity and an energizing mineral vein that lingers on and on.

title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2016 Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)
description: This ripe, lightly wood-aged wine is made from a blend of Chardonnay and Arinto. Rich while also crisp, the wine is warm, generous and packed with both fruit and minerality. It is still developing, so drink this wine from 2019.

title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2015 Meandro do Vale Meão Red (Douro)
description: This is the second wine of the Vale Meão estate, showing a slightly simpler vision of the density of the estate wines. It is serious in its own right, with a firm texture and powerful black fruits. The wine's name refers to the huge horseshoe bend of the river Douro around this iconic vineyard. Drink the wine from 2022.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2016 Mirabilis Grande Reserva White (Douro)
description: With its eight months in wood, this wine is opulent, spicy and ripe. It has great fruit as well as plenty of judicious wood-aging flavors. The yellow fruits such as pear are cut with citrus to give a rounded, rich wine that will age further. Drink from late 2018.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Ramón Bilbao 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: A dark, gritty, spicy nose with aromas of black peppercorn, coffee and black fruits sets up a high-acid palate with lemony oak. Flavors of vanilla and creamy oak dominate, while the finish echoes what came before: oak, creamy notes and lemony acid. Drink now through 2027.

title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Meaty, sanguine flavors greet the straightforward entry to this appellation wine, a showcase of the area's warm climate. Substantial concentration builds along the midpalate, dusted in clove, black cherry and berry.

title: Recanati 2016 Merlot (Upper Galilee)
description: Deep violet in the glass, this wine offers aromas of black cherry, strawberry and black pepper. It is bright on the palate, with soft tannins and flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, juniper berry and black pepper that round off in a zippy finish.

title: René Muré 2016 Signature Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The nose is very shy and wants to give little away. The palate slowly opens into a taut, elegant and fresh body adorned with flavors of cranberry and red cherry. All is toned down but comes with disarming purity and freshness, resulting in honesty and utter charm.

title: Rivera 2016 Preludio N.1 Chardonnay (Castel del Monte)
description: This bottling was first produced in 1985 and was the first commercial Chardonnay made in Puglia. Over 30 years later, this is a solid representation of the variety, grown on the limestone hills of the Castel del Monte DOC. Fermented in stainless steel and aged in cement vats, this wine exudes ripeness struck against tense mineral sensations. Juicy peach and honeydew melon flavors are wrapped around a core of crushed rocks. This is silken in feel, yet balanced by driving acidity.

title: Single Post 2015 Ockfener Bockstein Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: This punchy, fruity kabinett offers loads of ripe pink grapefruit, guava and caramelized sugar notes. Electric acidity refreshes the midpalate leading a long, lean finish. Delicious already but should hold well through 2020.

title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a bright fresh take on the grape, lightly spicy and showing a gentle dusting of cinnamon. The freshly cut pear flavors are perfectly ripe and densely packed.

title: Tablas Creek 2015 Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Plummy fruits meet with rosewater and tart strawberry on the nose of this bottling by vintner Jason Haas. Against a tannic backbone and chalky texture on the sip, there are punchy flavors of red and purple fruit, bolstered by solid acidity. It is quite easy to quaff.

title: Velvet Bee 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright, crisp black raspberry and sharp hibiscus tones make for a very pungent, nose-tickling aromatic start to this appellation blend. The palate is also sharp, with mace and allspice, while searing acidity cuts through the strawberry and raspberry flavors.

title: Villa Crespia NV Novalia Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Racy and linear, this lively sparker has delicate aromas of bread crust, citrus blossom and white stone fruit. On the palate, vibrant acidity and a racy perlage underscore candied lemon drop, yellow apple and white peach. A bitter almond note announces the close.

title: Villa Franciacorta 2013 Emozione Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: White wild flower, ripe orchard fruit, toasted nut and bread crust aromas lift out of the glass. The vibrant juicy palate tastes of Golden Delicious apple, candied tangerine zest and crystallized ginger zest alongside bright acidity and a lively perlage.

title: Villa Schinosa 2012 San Valentino Red (Puglia)
description: Sourced from clay-rich vineyards outside the coastal town of Trani, this blend of 50% Uva di Troia, 35% Merlot and 15% Syrah is slightly jammy on the nose in aromas of stewed red and black berries, with a dusting of coffee and crushed herbs. There's a pleasant roundness and plushness to the palate, where the fruit profile seems fresher in nature, accented by streaks of spiced game and cocoa nibs. Soft and approachable, there is just enough tannic and acidic cut, enjoy this wine for its immediate appeal.

title: Wittmann 2016 Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Pristine notes of lime zest, grapefruit and gooseberry persist from nose to finish in this vibrant, dry Riesling. Light bodied and bracing, it's a crisply textured wine with a refreshing, long finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 El Loco Rojo Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This is an appealing, substantive wine that combines ample fruit and spice aromas with well-concentrated black cherry flavors and a moderately tannic texture that will help it pair well with rich dishes. It's a classic Bordeaux-style blend made from 65% Cabernet Sauvignon plus the four other red Bordeaux varietals.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2016 Dom Off-Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Bracing lemon zest and orange blossom perfume brightens this robustly concentrated spätlese. Fresh tangerine and apricot flavors are bright and sweet, accented by spine tingling acidity and a reverberating orange-pith finish.

title: Blue Rock 2015 Baby Blue Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a stunning concoction, a mix of mostly Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, with smaller additions of Syrah, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Together they combine to offer a classically structured elegance of dried herb and juicy red currant that finds companionship in gamy meat and white pepper.
